description: iPhoto was a digital photograph manipulation software application developed by Apple Inc.
name: iPhoto

description: AppleWorks was an integrated office suite containing a word processor, database, and spreadsheet.
name: AppleWorks

description: Aperture was an image organizer developed by Apple for the macOS operating system. The software handled work such as importing and organizing image files, applying corrective adjustments and printing photographs.
name: Aperture

description: iWeb was a template-based WYSIWYG website creation tool that allowed users to create websites and blogs and customize them with their own text, photos, and movies.
name: iWeb

description: iDVD was a DVD authoring application for Mac OS that allows the user to burn QuickTime movies, MP3 music, and digital photos to a DVD.
name: iDVD

description: MobileMe was a subscription-based collection of online services and software offered by Apple Inc. All services were gradually transitioned to and eventually replaced by the free iCloud.
name: MobileMe

description: AirPort Express was a Wi-Fi base station with audio output capability.
name: AirPort Express

description: AirPort Extreme was a residential gateway combining the functions of a router, network switch, wireless access point and NAS as well as varied other functions.
name: AirPort Extreme

description: HomePod was a smart speaker with support for Siri and the Apple Music subscription service.
name: HomePod

description: AirPort Time Capsule was a wireless router featuring network-attached storage (NAS) and a residential gateway router.
name: AirPort Time Capsule

description: iPod Classic was a portable media player with a LCD display and hard drive for storage.
name: iPod Classic

description: iPod Nano was a portable media player introduced as a replacement for the iPod Mini.
name: iPod Nano

description: iPod Shuffle was a digital audio player. It was the smallest model in Apple's iPod family and the first iPod to use flash memory.
name: iPod Shuffle

description: iPod Socks were a set of multi-colored cotton knit socks for protection of iPods from damage during travel.
name: iPod Shuffle

description: PowerBook was a family of Macintosh laptop computers targeted at the professional market.
name: PowerBook
